alert.note: Alert for Macomb; Oakland; Wayne (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 12:40AM EDT until August 24 at 2:45AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Michigan, including the following counties, Macomb, Oakland and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EDT. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1237 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated increasing coverage of thunderstorms toward Pontiac and Flint which are expected to move southeast into the area. Heavy rain with these storms on top of earlier activity make urban and small stream flooding likely. - Rainfall rate of 1 inch per hour and briefly higher is possible in the strongest storms. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Warren, Livonia, Troy, Southfield, Taylor, St. Clair Shores, Pontiac, Novi, Romulus, Mount Clemens, New Baltimore, Flat Rock, Milford, Holly, Richmond, Grosse Pointe, Downtown Detroit and Canton. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
